instructions: Brown the ground beef in a non-stick skillet.
Combine dry minced onion, salt, chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, cumin, oregano, and flour in a bowl to create the taco seasoning.
Add the taco seasoning and water to the ground beef.
Cook until the water is evaporated and the meat is well coated in seasoning.
Warm tortillas in the microwave or on a dry skillet.
Fill each tortilla with the seasoned ground beef and desired toppings.
cooking_tips: For crispier tacos, heat the tortillas in a dry skillet until they are slightly browned.
Adjust the amount of spices in the taco seasoning to your preference.
Feel free to add other desired toppings, such as shredded cheese, black beans, or jalapenos.
